availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Burlington, Kentucky, native. Vermont native. Married Jemima Hawes. Father of Joseph B. Hawes, Maryann Hawes, Ellen Hawes, Henrietta Hawes, Louisa Hawes, and Charles Hawes. Merchant in Burlington in 1850 and 1860. Owned six enslaved people in Burlington in 1850. Justice of the Peace for the Boone County Court in 1860. Owned five enslaved people in Florence, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District No. 2, Town of Burlington, p. 177; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District No. 2; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Town of Burlington, p. 39; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence District, p. 3; KYR-0001-017-0040.
